intro: Bomarea janeirensis, commonly known as the pink bomarea, is a striking flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Alstroemeriaceae and is characterized by its vibrant pink or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces showy bracts that often resemble petals, enhancing its ornamental appeal. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
